course_format: Duration of the course is 8-16 academic hours. Two full days or 4 half-days.
The course includes approximately 40% hands on lab work.
objectives: Use GitHub without any background in programming to make changes to data files in a corporation or to make non-code contribution to Open Source projects.
prerequisites: Access to the GitHub web site and a working email address.

entries: Creating a simple web site using Markdown.
syllabus.title: Markdown used by GitHub

entries: Making a change to a repository
syllabus.title: Making changes to other porjects

target_audience: Teams of software developers and programmers who need to work co-operatively on projects.
text: This course will help you, a non-technical person make changes to data files on GitHub.
This can be usefule to manage the content of a web site, update data in a corporation or in an Open Source project.
title: Making changes on GitHub for non-technical people
